node.text:
Cooking lesson with @natalieportman 💗
We had so much fun baking vegan matcha donuts together! 🍩
Grateful for this lovely experience🙏🏻
BTS in my stories! 

Recipe for my vegan matcha donuts some posts back and on the blog 🌱
Love, Yuki♡ 
.

node.text:
Strawberry and raspberry pie with floral crust 🌸♥️
Feeling romantic today for 8th years wedding anniversary with my love 🥰

Ingredients for a 22cm / 9" pan

Crust 
375g (3 cups) all purpose flour 
15g (1 tbsp) caster sugar
1/2 tsp salt 
180g cold unsalted butter, cubes refrigerated 
80 ml (2/3 cup) ice water *
*May vary +/- 10 ml
Egg wash + granulated sugar 

For the lattice crust, I used the same recipe and I added Rose blossoms and Peony buds @suncorefoods 

For Vegan, replace butter with vegan butter (stick) and egg wash with plant milk. 

Filling 
500g fresh strawberries, sliced
250g fresh raspberries 
1 tbsp lemon juice 
100g light brown sugar 
2 tbsp corn starch 
2 tsp vanilla bean paste 

Make the dough (you'll need 2x this recipe to make the base and the lattice crust) 
Cut butter into cubes and refrigerate while you prepare the ingredients.
Add flour, salt and sugar to a food processor and pulse a few time to combine. Add cold butter and pulse 7-8 times until it looks crumbly. Add ice water 1 tablespoon at a time, pulsing once after each addition. 
When you've added all of the water, pulse until the dough starts to come together (7-10pulses). 
*in dry climate/season you may need to add some more water. 

Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and bring the dough together without kneading. Wrap and refrigerate for 1h. 

Make the filling:
Wash, dry and cut strawberries. Add them to a bowl together with the raspberries and remaining ingredients. Stir a couple times with a spatula then set aside. 

Preheat oven to 190C degrees. 
Roll out plain dough into a round, large enough to cover the bottom and sides of the pan. 

Roll out second dough into a rectangle and place edible flower petals on top. Gently press petals with rolling pin. Cut dough into strips for the lattice crust. 

Place filling over the base crust and cover with the strips into a lattice pattern. 
Brush with egg wash and sprinkle with granulated sugar. 

Bake on the middle-low rack of the oven for 45 minutes. 
Let cool down completely before slicing!

node.text:
Blueberry lemon donuts 💛
Super easy recipe, delicious and vegan 🌱
Enjoying late summer weather ☺️

Yields: 8 large or 12 small donuts 
Ingredients for the donuts 
Dry
190 g (1 1/2 cups) All Purpose Flour
2 tsp Baking Powder
1/4 tsp sea salt
150g (3/4 cup) caster sugar 

Wet
180ml (3/4 cup) full fat soy milk *
40g (2 Tbsp) unsweetened coconut yogurt *
50g (4 Tbsp) vegan butter, at room temp*
1 tsp vanilla bean paste/ extract 
1 tbsp lemon zest 
*can be replaced with dairy products 

Add-ins
1/2 cup blueberries, fresh or frozen 
1 tsp corn starch 

Lemon glaze 
80g (1/2cup) powdered sugar 
1/4 tsp vermillion annatto powder +
1/4 tsp canary yellow powder @suncorefoods (optional, for the color)
1 tbsp+ 1 tsp lemon juice 

Instructions 
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Lightly grease donut tray if you're not using non-stick. 
2. Whisk the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar into a large mixing bowl.
3. Add the plant milk, coconut yogurt, melted butter, lemon zest and vanilla and whisk to combine. Don't over-mix. 
4. Add blueberries and corn starch to a bowl and toss to cover. 
5. Fold the blueberries into the batter and mix until just combined. 
6. Transfer the donut batter into the mold with a spoon. 
7. Bake for 15-17 minutes until set on top.
8. Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before transferring the donuts to a wire cooling rack.
9. Allow to cool completely before glazing.
10. Whilst the donuts are cooling, make the glaze. Combine powdered sugar, natural color powders and lemon juice and mix until smooth but thick. Dip the top of each donut and let set over a rack.

node.text:
Apricot and blackberry pie 🍑💗
This might be my favorite pie filling so far! 
What should I bake next?

For the base:
375g (3 cups) all purpose flour
30g (2tbsp) granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 tsp vanilla bean paste 
125g (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter / vegan butter cut into small chunks
7-8 tablespoons ice cold water

To make the colored crust, I used the same recipe and added velvet red beet powder, @suncorefoods. 

For the filling
250g fresh blackberries 
450g fresh apricots, sliced 
30g (4 tbsp) cornstarch
100g (1/2 cup) granulated sugar
1 pinch salt
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tsp lemon zest 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 

To make the crust, add flour, sugar and salt to a food processor and pulse to combine. Add cold butter and vanilla and blend until crumbly. Add 1 tbsp of ice cold water at a time until the dough is soft and sticks together when pressed between your fingers. Refrigerate for at least 1h. 

To make the colored crust, prepare the same recipe, divide into as many pieces as colors you want to make. Add natural color powder to each. Refrigerate for at least 1h.

Preheat the oven to 190C degrees.
Combine all the filling ingredients and set aside.
Roll out the plain dough to 3mm and cover the bottom of the tart pan. (I use a pan with removable bottom for easy removal). 
Spread the filling over the crust evenly. 

Roll out the colored doughs to 3mm and cut into even strips. Place each strip over the pie into a lattice pattern. 

Brush with plant milk and sprinkle with granulated sugar. 

Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden brown. 

Let cool down and serve with vanilla ice cream!

Tropical cookies🦩
With mango & passion fruit curd 💛 
Because cookies can be an August thing too. 

Ingredients for about 50 small cookies
For the vanilla cookies 
300g all purpose flour 
1/2 tsp pink salt
1 tsp lemon zest
80g icing sugar 
150g unsalted butter/ plant butter (stick), cold
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 
3 tbsp cold, unsweetened plant milk 

For the mango & passion fruit curd 
240g (1 cup) mango purée (1 large mango)
2 tsp marigold passion fruit powder @suncorefoods 
50g (1/4 cup) sugar 
10g (1 tbsp) corn starch 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste/ extract
2 tbsp lemon juice 
60g vegan butter/ butter 

To make the curd: 
Peel and chop mango and blend together with passion fruit powder until smooth. Pass through a sieve for a smoother texture. 
In a small saucepan, whisk sugar and corn starch. Add vanilla, lemon juice and mango/ passion fruit purée and whisk to combine. Heat over medium heat. 
Add butter 1 tbsp at time and cook on medium whisking continuously until it starts to thicken. - about 30 min. Transfer to a heat proof container to cool. 
Store in the fridge for up to 1 week. It will thicken more as it cools. 

For the cookies: 
In the bowl of a food processor, add flour, icing sugar, salt and lemon zest. Pulse a couple of times to combine. 
Add cubed cold butter and pulse a few times until it looks like bread crumbs. 
Add vanilla and plant milk one tbsp at a time and mix until the dough comes together. 
The dough should be soft, but not sticky.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat your oven to 180C degrees. 

Cut out cookie shapes with cookie cutters. Use a mini cutter to cut out the center of half of the cookies.
Re-roll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all the dough is used. 
Arrange cookies on lined baking trays.

Bake cookies for 8-9 min or until the edges become golden brown. (Baking time depends on size)
 Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 2 mins before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. 

To assemble, spread 1 tsp of mango& passion fruit curd over the bottom of one cookie and gently press a cut-out center cookie on top.

node.text:
Strawberry pie 🍓
The braided lattice crust is flavored with lemon zest and it is naturally colored with red beet powder @suncorefoods 💗
Which flavor should I make next?

For the base:
375g (3 cups) all purpose flour
30g (2tbsp) granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 tsp lemon zest 
125g (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter / vegan butter cut into small chunks
7-8 tablespoons ice cold water

To make the lattice crust, I used the same recipe and added red beet powder @suncorefoods to to make the pink dough. 

For the filling
750g fresh strawberries 
30g (4 tbsp) cornstarch
100g (1/2 cup) granulated sugar
1 pinch salt
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tsp lemon zest 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 

To make the crust, add flour, sugar, lemon zest and salt to a food processor and pulse to combine. Add cold butter and blend until crumbly. Add 1 tbsp of ice cold water at a time until the dough is soft and sticks together when pressed between your fingers. Refrigerate for at least 1h. 

To make the lattice crust, prepare the same recipe and add natural red beet powder. Refrigerate for at least 1h.

Preheat the oven to 190C degrees.
Combine all the filling ingredients and set aside.
Roll out the plain dough to 5mm and cover the bottom of the tart pan. (I use a pan with removable bottom for easy removal). 
Spread the filling over the crust evenly. 

Roll out the colored doughs to 3mm and cut into even strips. Divide each strip into 3 thinner stripes and braid them together. Place the braids over the pie into a lattice pattern. 

Brush with plant milk and sprinkle with granulated sugar. 

Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown. 

Let cool down and serve with vanilla ice cream!

node.text:
Floral shortbread cookies🌸
Which one is your favorite?
I used Rose petals, Peony buds, Forget me not flowers and Carnation blossoms  @suncorefoods ♥️

Ingredients for 40 medium cookies 
160g softened butter/ plant butter (stick) 
1/2 tsp vanilla bean paste 
80g powdered sugar 
1/2 tsp salt 
2 tsp lemon juice 
1/2 tbsp lemon zest
1 tsp corn starch 
250g (2 cups) spelt (or all purpose) flour 
1/4 cup edible flowers *
*I used Rose petals, peony buds, Forget me not flowers, Carnation blossoms @suncorefoods (softened into warm water, then dried). 

In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat butter and vanilla until light and fluffy.
Add icing sugar and salt; beat until light well combined. 
Scrape bowl down and add flour while beating on low and mix until combined.
Shape the dough into a disc, sprinkle petals on top and roll out on a clean surface to 5mm. 
Wrap in plastic and chill until firm. At least an hour. 
Use a cookie cutter to cut out desired shape and place cookies on a cookie tray or lined baking tray. 

Preheat oven to 170C degrees. 
Bake cookies for 10  minutes or until the bottoms are golden brown. 
Dip into chocolate of choice!

node.text:
Chocolate & Blackberry pie 💜
The lattice crust is naturally colored Matcha powder and Ebony Carrot powder @suncorefoods 
I used an embossing rolling pin to make the flower design! How do you like it?

Ingredients for a 22cm (9") pie 
For the chocolate base:
375g (3 cups) all purpose flour
10g (1 tbsp) cacao powder 
45g (3tbsp) granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
125g (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter / vegan butter cut into small chunks
7-8 tablespoons ice cold water

To make the lattice crust, I used the same recipe as the base (without cacao powder) and added Midori matcha powder and ebony carrot powder @suncorefoods. 

For the filling 
250g (2,5 cups) fresh blueberries
450g (4 cups) fresh blackberries 
30g (4 tbsp) cornstarch
130g granulated sugar
1 pinch salt
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tsp lemon zest 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 

To make the chocolate crust, add flour, sugar, cacao and salt to a food processor and pulse to combine. Add cold butter and blend until crumbly. Add 1 tbsp of ice cold water at a time until the dough is soft and sticks together when pressed between your fingers. Refrigerate for at least 1h. 

To make the lattice crust, prepare the same recipe, divide into as many pieces as colors you want to make. Add natural color powder to each. Refrigerate for at least 1h.

Preheat the oven to 190C degrees.
Combine all the filling ingredients and set aside.
Roll out the plain dough to 3mm and cover the bottom of the tart pan. (I use a pan with removable bottom for easy removal). 
Spread the filling over the crust evenly. 

Roll out the colored doughs to 3mm and cut into even strips. Place each strip over the pie into a lattice pattern. 

Brush with plant milk and sprinkle with granulated sugar. 

Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden brown. 

Let cool down and serve with vanilla ice cream!

node.text:
Summer Berry shortbread cookies 💜
I used an embossed rolling pin for the design and the filling is made of blackberries and blueberries! How do you like it?

Ingredients for 25 cookies (12-13 cookie sandwiches)
Cookies
250g all purpose flour 
90g icing sugar 
1/4 tsp salt 
1 tbsp honey (maple syrup or agave for V)
125g cold butter/ plant-based butter 
1 egg or egg replacer 
1 tbsp lemon zest 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 

Berry curd
300g (3 cups) blackberries
100g (1 cup) blueberries 
100g (1/2 cup) sugar 
10g (1 tbsp) corn starch 
240g (1 cup) blackberry purée 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 
2 tbsp lemon juice 
40g plant butter (stick) /dairy butter 

Blackberry curd: 
Cook blackberries and blueberries in a saucepan over medium heat until they're soft. 
Blend and pass the mixture through a sieve. Set aside. 
Whisk together sugar and corn starch in a small saucepan. Add blackberry purée , lemon juice and vanilla. 
Add butter 1 tbsp at time and cook on medium whisking continuously until it starts to thicken. Transfer to a heat proof container to cool. 
Store in the fridge for up to 1 week. It will thicken more as it cools. 

Cookies
Place flour, icing sugar, salt, lemon zest in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and whisk to combine. 
Add butter and honey and beat until it looks like breadcrumbs. 
Add egg and beat until the dough comes together. Flatten into a disc between 2 sheets of parchment paper and refrigerate for 1 hour. 
Roll out dough to 6 mm with a plain rolling pin. You can then use an embossed rolling pin to add a design. 
Refrigerate dough for 20 minutes. 
Preheat oven to 170C degrees.
Cut out cookies with a cookie cutter. Cut out the center of half of the cookies using a mini cutter.
Bake the cookies for 8-9 minutes. 

To assemble: place 1 tsp of blackberry curd in the middle of the cookie and top with a cut-out cookie.

node.text:
Nectarine and raspberry pie💗
How do you like this lattice crust?
It is naturally colored with cerise prickly pear powder and safflower powder @suncorefoods 

For the base:
375g (3 cups) all purpose flour
30g (2tbsp) granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 tsp lemon zest 
125g (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter / vegan butter cut into small chunks
7-8 tablespoons ice cold water

To make the lattice crust, I used the same recipe and added canary yellow powder and cerise prickly pear @suncorefoods. 

For the filling
400g fresh raspberries 
300g (3 medium) nectarines, thinly sliced 
30g (4 tbsp) cornstarch
100g (1/2 cup) granulated sugar
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tsp lemon zest 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 

To make the crust, add flour, sugar, lemon zest and salt to a food processor and pulse to combine. Add cold butter and blend until crumbly. Add 1 tbsp of ice cold water at a time until the dough is soft and sticks together when pressed between your fingers. Refrigerate for at least 1h. 

To make the lattice crust, prepare the same recipe, divide into as many pieces as colors you want to make. Add natural color powder to each. Refrigerate for at least 1h.

Preheat the oven to 190C degrees.
Combine all the filling ingredients and set aside.
Roll out the plain dough to 3mm and cover the bottom of the tart pan. (I use a pan with removable bottom for easy removal). 
Spread the filling over the crust evenly. 

Roll out the colored doughs to 3mm and cut into even strips. Place each strip over the pie into a lattice pattern. 

Brush with plant milk and sprinkle with granulated sugar. 

Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden brown. 

Let cool down and serve with vanilla ice cream!

node.text:
Apricot, ginger and Passion fruit cookies 🧡
When you want a cookie that feels like summer ☀️☀️
Happy Sunday!

For the jam
500g apricots, pitted and cut into small pieces (fresh or frozen)
200-230g granulated sugar *
1 tbsp lemon juice 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 
1 tsp grated ginger 
1-2 tsp passion fruit powder @suncorefoods
*depends on how sweet are the apricots 

For the cookies 
Makes: 35-40 small cookie sandwiches 

110g (1/2 cup) plant butter (stick) or dairy butter
30g (1/4 cup) powdered sugar 
50g (1/4 cup) caster sugar
1 egg (Sub: 1 flax egg for vegan)*
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 
1 tsp lemon zest (1 lemon)
1/8 teaspoon salt
70g (1/2 cup) almond flour
190g (1 1/2 cups) all-purpose flour
1/8 tsp baking powder 

*1 flax egg =1 tbsp freshly ground flax seed+3 tbsp water

Instructions for the jam
In a large bowl, or container, combine apricots, sugar and lemon juice. 
Refrigerate overnight. (Don't skip this step or It will take much longer to cook the jam). 
Place the apricot mixture into a large pot and cook over medium heat until it starts to thicken (30minutes). It is ready when a teaspoon of jam  isn't runny when poured over a plate. 
Add grated ginger, passion fruit powder and vanilla and blend with an immersion blender. 

Pour the warm jam into warm sterilized jars. (Do not pour hot jam into cold glasses or they will crack!). Close the lid and let the jars cool upside down. 
After opening, keep in the fridge and consume within 2-3 weeks. 

Cookies:
In the bowl of a stand mixer, beat butter until smooth (1 min). Add sugars, lemon zest and vanilla and beat until fluffy and light in color (5 min). Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.  Add egg and mix to combine. Add almond flour and mix until just combine. 
Slowly mix in the flour, baking powder and salt beating until just combined. Remove dough from mixer and place it between 2 sheets of parchment paper. Roll the dough to about 6 mm thick and shape into a disk. Refrigerate for 20 min.
Preheat oven to 180C degrees. 
Cut out an even number of cookies with a cookie cutter. Use a smaller, decorative cutter to cut a shape out of the center of half of the cookies. 
Bake for 6-8 minutes.

node.text:
Blueberry pie 💜
The lattice crust is naturally colored with ebony carrot powder and globe amaranth flowers @suncorefoods 
How do you like it?
Lovely idea @saltedhoney.co 

Ingredients for a 22cm (9") pie
For the base:
375g (3 cups) all purpose flour
30g (2tbsp) granulated sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
125g (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter / vegan butter cut into small chunks
7-8 tablespoons ice cold water

To make the lattice crust, I used the same recipe and added Ebony carrot powder @suncorefoods and Globe amaranth flowers @suncorefoods. 

For the filling
700g (5 cups) fresh blueberries
30g (4 tbsp) cornstarch
150g (3/4 cup) granulated sugar
1 pinch salt
2 tablespoons lemon judice
1 tsp lemon zest 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 

To make the crust, add flour, sugar and salt to a food processor and pulse to combine. Add cold butter and blend until crumbly. Add 1 tbsp of ice cold water at a time until the dough is soft and sticks together when pressed between your fingers. Refrigerate for at least 1h. 

To make the lattice crust, prepare the same recipe, divide into as many pieces as colors you want to make. Add natural color powder to each. Refrigerate for at least 1h.

Preheat the oven to 190C degrees.
Combine all the filling ingredients and set aside.
Roll out the plain dough to 3mm and cover the bottom of the tart pan. (I use a pan with removable bottom for easy removal). 
Spread the filling over the crust evenly. 

Roll out the colored doughs to 3mm and cut into even strips. Place each strip over the pie into a lattice pattern. 

Brush with plant milk and sprinkle with granulated sugar. 

Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden brown. 

Let cool down and serve with vanilla ice cream!

node.text:
Healthy cherry magnums 🍒💗
Easy to make, healthier and better than store-bought!
This recipe is dairy-free, refined-sugar-free, gluten-free and vegan friendly 🌱
Happy Sunday!
Love, Yuki♡ 

Ingredients for the vegan ice cream
(Makes 12 mini magnum) 
1 cup (250g) coconut cream (solid part only)
1/4 cup cherry syrup (see below) 
1 tsp cerise prickly pear powder @suncorefoods (optional, for the color)
1 tbsp maple syrup 
1 tsp vanilla bean paste 
1 tbsp coconut yogurt 

Cherry syrup
1 cup cherries , pitted and halved 
1 tbsp maple syrup 
1/2 tsp vanilla bean paste 
1 tbsp water 

Toppings 
chocolate of choice 
Rose petals @suncorefoods 
Cacao nibs @suncorefoods 

To make the cherry syrup, combine cherries, water and maple syrup in a saucepan and heat on medium until the cherries are very soft. 
Blend with an immersion blender, pass the mixture through a sieve and place back into the saucepan. Heat over medium heat, add vanilla and let simmer until it reduces and starts to thicken. (15 min). Let cool down completely. 

To make cherry ice cream
Blend all the ingredients together. 
Fill the mini magnum molds, leaving a little space to add the cherry syrup. 
Freeze for at least 4 hours. 
Add about 1/3 tbsp of cherry syrup on top of the ice creams and place back into the freezer for at least 3 hours (or overnight). 

Melt chocolate of choice and place in a tall
Glass. Dip each magnum into the chocolate. Enjoy immediately or keep in freezer to enjoy later!
